review_title: Approachable Leadership Team that Values its Employees
pros: Having worked at Immaculata for over two decades, I feel I know the campus climate -- and it has never been better. My colleagues and I truly enjoy having Fridays off during the summer and very generous vacation/holiday time off as well. I also took advantage of the tuition benefit and earned my master's degree. I feel valued and appreciated by the entire campus community.
cons: I have a long commute...but there is plenty of parking and it's free!

pros: kind, friendly, balanced, beautiful campus,
cons: salary, vision, and growth need to be desperately improved

pros: nice environment that does not unfortunatley make up for the pay
cons: pay is very very poor

pros: Friendly community, mission driven, small campus size
cons: Small departments with large tasks

pros: Easy hours and very flexible

review_title: Best place to work in Higher ed

pros: The Benefits were very good

review_title: Was fine, not so much now
pros: Good holiday time and benefits, small school, close knit
cons: Catholic, low pay, poor handling of covid and layoffs

pros: great people, mission driven, great facilities
cons: You will work hard at immaculata, but the work is rewarding

pros:
-Peculiar but typically pleasant students
-Beautiful Campus
-Generally nice community environment
-Tradition oriented (if you like traditions)
-Some supportive and invested faculty
cons:
- Top heavy salary wise
- Not very diverse
- Lacks innovation
- Minimal building space
- Over protective of land
- Core values are not practiced by upper administration
- Some Secretive and self fulfilling administration
- Not open to ideas and true calculated risk taking 
- A component of fear can be traced in top down communication
- Protective of non effective and belligerent employees (example  
  Director of Library)
- Low pay for a lot of work
- Maintains many uniformed professional staff 
- Operates with impracticality

pros: The students at CLLL were exceptionally responsive and motivated!
cons: The new administrators were so biased, prejudiced and discriminated against me ( in spite of my excellent anonymous student evaluations -- which I have.  A religious university should uphold the Jesus, Mother Mary standard of fairness, love and complete recognition of the individual teacher's true' worth.  The skin color, and physical appearance must not be a deterrent to continue seven years of excellent service ---well documented -- rendered to Immaculata University, Pa.

review_title: Not given much from the top administration to do your job
pros: Students, colleagues and  academic staff work very hard on behalf of students
cons: poor salaries, poor work environments, and no action taken by administration to correct poor treatment of staff.

pros: Small welcoming positive work environment. Employees care for each other and most importantly the students. Nurturing and encouraging.
cons: Pay for staff is below the regional average. Cost of living raises at minimum should be provided yearly. This issue has affected moral.

pros: Great place to work. The people really care about the students and the adjunct professors.  The full time staff is always willing to help.  Truly a peaceful, friendly atmosphere.
cons: Adjunct pay is less than surrounding universities.

review_title: students are great/management not so much
pros: i had a lot of fun working with the students
cons: senior management is terrible and difficult to work with

job_title: Cleaning Clean Stuff in Havertown, PA
pros: Good benefits, full tuition fro made of hire
cons: poor salary, human resources does not handle complaints well.  If you are slighted by someone above you on the ladder don't look for anyone to care

pros:

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in West Chester, PA
pros: Beautiful campus. Loved the Sisters of Immaculate Heart.
cons: Poor pay. Very disrespectful to students and staff. Couldn't wait to quit. I ran fast out that door! Horrible environment. Staff were mean and back stabbing to each other.Felt sorry for those students. Paying all that money. They scored very low on the NCLEX but was not their fault.

pros: The people are kind and friendly
cons: The morale is very low

pros: Excellent opportunity for job responsibility growth, education benefit
cons: Lack of transparency of policy and updates. Hard to move up
